[4978404]

Seriously, I think that's just a theory about STR, what matters is the RNG.
--
My theory:
The moment you pick an opponent the RNG generates a loss or a win (ofc, better chances for better brutes). There's always a chance that you disarm the opponent weapon or shield regardless of str or agi. It's a low change, but the RNG may cause strange things.
-
You know those matches where your brute uses FB then throws a weapon? Or when you're pissed that you never dodge or block regardless of your high Agi or Shield + CA? It's all probabilities. Suppose you have a better brute and there's 95% chance you win due to that. But damn, it hits those 5% of losing, and your brute will act stupid, and your opponent will disarm you without shock and multi-hit like a boss.
-
I'd like to see several matches with high str, but poor brutes overall, disarming others' weapon and shield without shock. I already had one, but had miserably low life and no resistant, losing 3 matches a day and I can't remember having him disarming others often.

On october 25, 2013
MrPapaya

I think both fights r poor judgement cases, as ur opponents have either poor strength and agility (one gets stuck with bumps), plus u'r using a backup brute.


Once ur brute gets disarmed, she will lose the fight against most average+ opponents. Shield+Counter Attack combo will be near impossible for her to overcome, as well as a % to dodge a fatal blow. I would not call this a good brute.


If u wonna keep exploring this path (20 levels is just the bare minimum, and if she's winning then keep going) u'r gonna need 6th sense for ur whip, one way or the other. Don't take hatchet and keep going to 30, stock up on agility when u can and hopefully u'll get a heavy-weapon for that Bodybuilder. Otherwise, that's a forkpoint. U could be better off gearing ur build to support whip rather than mixing it with a heavy-wep.


If u wonna explore a different path, What Floja said, but better to fork at Toughened Skin than Armor.

On october 25, 2013
coro

Yeah, forking just means that you pick something different at a particular level. Picking the exact same things at each level will result in the same options being available in the levels that follow

Remember to save your list of choices somewhere, so that you can compare the alternate versions of your brute and keep improving the best one

MrPapaya

Alpe's right. The critical point of ur brute is that it needs to support both its Thief skill with agility/determination/relentless, as well as its light weapons with strength/WM/MA. It's a small chance of success.


So, best would be to deny the knife and WM-dependency, and keep pushing the Thief build and hope u'll get ample strength support for Sai. Sai+CA+Shield is gr8, but u'll often lose the higher ground once Thief is activated.

[4398]
Florin88

1. player A has Leek
player B has Halberd and the best Counter-Rate possible
player A attacks player B.


Q: Leek can't be dodged or blocked, but it possible that player B Counter the Leek attack?


2. player A & B have the best block in game (Counter Attack included).


Q: It is possible that if player B blocks the attack from player A, Counter Attacks player A, player A block the Counter-Attack from player B then Counter-Attack the Counter Attacks and so on...? Or it just stops after 1st Counter Attack?


Thx!

1. Leek can't be blocked or dodged but CAN be countered.
2. Yes, it stops after 1 counter, but if it's blocked, the next time the brute that blocked is hit, he will counter, whether or not he blocks it. It's like he saves the counter attack for later.

[1848820]

[FAQ] Tournament/Destiny/Ranking (v2)
What happens if I win a BL tournament ?
Instead of ranking up, you get an ear. Otherwise, it's the same as winning any other tournament.
There is a separate ranking for brutes who have won the most ears.


If you choose to cut ears rather than level up your brute, you will be offered the choice of same or new destiny after winning each Brutal Legend tournament.

On may 16, 2014
45424
goatwhat is the limit to damage that can be done with bare hands?
i see flail doing like 200 dmg but fist punches / attacks only do like 40 without fierce brute with martial arts and a shit load of str

From the stats explained thread:
45424
I have to revise the formula, after seeing that the estimated strength bonus constant (9%) won't fit in the calculation of base broadsword damage.

I'm very sure that the damage of fists can be found by (B + NK) * S * R - A, where K is the damage per strength point within the range of 0.33333 to 0.36667, and B is the base fist damage within the range of 3.93333 to 4.33333. But the theory of a constant strength bonus has to be scrapped.

Instead we should use K, which is damage per strength point, a value different for every weapon. In this case, even hammer damage can be calculated by the following formula:

Damage = floor((B + NK) * S * R - A) * H
B = base damage of weapon (constant for each weapon)
N = strength
K = damage per strength of weapon (constant for each weapon)
S = skills multiplier (weapons master x1.50 / martial arts x2.00 / lead skeleton x0.70)
R = random number between 1.00 and 1.50
A = armor (additive; armor 5 / toughened skin 2)
H = hammer multiplier (x4.00 if hammer; x1.00 if not)

Note: this also means some weapons are weaker than others in the long run, since the percentage increase of damage of some are lower than 9%. (e.g. <8% for broadsword)

Note 2: fist percentage increase ranges from 7.69% to 9.32%. More data is needed for more accurate result.

Any thoughts?

On june 22, 2014
45424

There's a hidden initiative counter for every unit on the field. There are two possibilities:

If it is observed that First Strike brute always attacks 2-3 times before the opponent moves:

1. You need a certain amount (depending on weapon) of initiative (times a random number close to 1 to make it more random) to make an attack.

2. Your speed determines the rate of your initiative gain.

If it is observed that the number of attacks from a First Strike brute depends on their speed:

1. You need a certain amount (depending on both weapon and speed) of initiative (times a random number close to 1 to make it more random) to make an attack.

2. The rate of initiative gain is constant for everyone.

You also have to start from level one again and you can keep joining the same tournament after you win and you ear will go up by 1 everytime you win a tournament.

To pelell1: As much as I hate telling people, I think you should restart. If you are only getting 3 fights a day, it is not worth it to wait 1.5 months to gain one level. You will eventually get very sick of your brute, then regret not restarting earlier.


However, the problem with restarting is that I do not know how much better your brute can get with the current destiny that you have. On paper he looks fine with shield, MA, CA (missing FS), but BL is a tough environment and all the other brutes have the essentials and often more than that. If you want to restart, you have to be smart about it: branch early and find a good selection of skills & weapons before you hit lv20+.


The alternative is to find a backup brute that can help you gain more wins. Ultimately it is your call. Good luck

It's quite common, especially when you create your brutes almost at the same time or at least few mins/sec difference. 2 of my brutes have 70-85% similarity, from stats to skills, very close as if they're sharing the same destiny. I created them within a minute.

Rumor has it, server time is somehow connected to destiny when you create a brute, each skill becomes common in certain period. For example armor becomes common at some point in time, sometimes ironhead or untouchable. Players with multiple brute must have noticed this.

On december 24, 2014
Gordzilla
Agni

Alright, got questions. Quite new to the game so no idea how most of the stuff works.

1) Tournaments: How does the destiny thing work? Let us say that I picked something not so good at lvl 3 but got something pretty good at lvl 10. Would I have to pick the same thing at lvl 3 and on all levels for that matter if I want to get the same choice at lvl 10?

If yes, then if you have a high level brute do you have to remember all that stuff and make the exact same choices if you won a tourny and want to advance to the next rank with the same set of skills and stuff?

First of all. Write down your brutes choices. It is the best way.

Your brutes destiny relies on what choices you make. If you get something great at level 10, then you need to choose the same choices leading up to that. But that doesn't mean you may not get that choice again in more levels.

A lot of people branch their brutes, rather than taking a New Destiny ( unless it's very poor or if they are bored of their brute ) Which basically means they keep the same destiny but choose different on a level up to see if it leads to a better brute.

Your other questions can be searched on the forum.

On december 24, 2014
pelell1

In answer to question 4 - Yes, you will get the chance to pick same or new destiny after each Brutal Legend tourney.

In answer to the second query - Yes, if you pick same destiny and change you picks you can simply (or not so simply) win a tourney and choose same destiny then pick the original options to have the same brute.

The jargon for this is "fork" as in a fork in the road

In my opinion, forking around (pun intended) with a destiny is the wiser choice.

Enjoy!
On december 25, 2014

Enjoy!

I'd be careful when forking around, you never know what will come next. On the upside you get the excitement of the new but there might be trouble it you want to go back to your old. Also if you forget where you forked last and title it wrong... That's a big nono. So be careful!

Gordzilla

Pets are actually better higher up than low levels. As they can take deadly blows, saving you to fight another day. It's quite common to see a brute with 2 or 3 dogs and they end up taking ALL your blows before you die a flawless death..

I dont like dogs. I only accept Panthers or Bears ( although I have only been offered both a couple times in the years I have been playing )

There is no rush, so I don't see the reason why you need to level up faster. It's all about finding the brutes best path. Be it 2 weeks or 2 months.

I'm a fan of the initiative points idea

So basically each side has a turn, and will do actions until they can't anymore (aka used up most of their points)
A turn transition regenerates points for both sides (maybe)

The double throw was just your brute storing enough initiative to do two throws before it got low on points

NukaCola

What is the point of restarting the brute to lvl1 after winning the tournament?

Should I try to win tournaments or simply level up the brute?

It's to let you try out other choices when your Brute levels up
If you haven't written down what you picked each time, then going back to level 1 could result in a different Brute (either by picking different things or straight out going with a new destiny)

Anyway the point of winning tournaments is to refine your Brute and figure out the best upgrade path
If you like how your Brute is, you can just stay in the tournament that it won and keep going for levels

anyone knows why I took punch after my hit landed at the end of the fight, since opponent don't have hostility ???

http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/135922...
On june 20, 2015
Abel
Ninja

anyone knows why I took punch after my hit landed at the end of the fight, since opponent don't have hostility ???

http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/135922...

Because the brute had a counter attack saved up. Let me explain it
1. Opponent attacks you
2. You use Hostility to hit her back
3. She blocks Hostility (This is the point where the Counter attack is saved up)
4. Since you're using Shuriken, she can't use her Counter Attack since you need to do a direct attack.
5. She disarms your Shuriken
6. You run up to attack
7. She uses the Counter attack hit she had saved up

On june 29, 2015
Francisco
CrystalizeGapjal
Level: 38
HP: 501
Do you need to know what the HP was at level 37?

No c: first, i need to calculate the Default HP, What is that? it's the HP that does not affected by skills (Vitality, Inmortal) and mascots. This is the formula for calculating:
(Levels - 1)*1.5+50
Replaced
(38-1)*1.5+50
37*1.5+50
55+50
105
105 HP it's the Default HP. We calculate the points of endurance, which are modified with the skills:
(Total HP - Default HP)/6/3.5
Replaced
(501-105)/6/3.5
396/6/3.5
66/3.5
The result leaves inconsistent, when this is the result , we add 0.5 to the previous result:
66.5/3.5=19

You have 19 points of Endurance. Now, We calculate with the 2 skills:
[(Endurance*1.5)*3.5]*6 + Default HP
Replaced
[(19*1.5)*3.5]*6 + 105
(28*3.5)*6 + 105
(98 )*6 + 105
588 + 105
693

You will have 693 of HP (695 for the levelup) I did what I could , I hope it has cleared up a bit all this seems complicated, but it is not. Greetings

Paragon

Hey, are thrown weapon's combo rate affected at all by speed boosts?
On july 23, 2015
Abel
ParagonHey, are thrown weapon's combo rate affected at all by speed boosts?

In the case of Thrown Weapons, Combo rate does not affect them. Speed affects the interval of the weapons, Agility does nothing to have them thrown more frequently.

Aardvark

IMO explore more. I would try to avoid recon if you can. Its a major disadvantage in higher levels especially without first strike. You'll probably find you'll get defeated without even having a turn after, say, level 75, when brutes have really high strength and multi-hit every attack.
immo isn't so great without vitality imo as you don't take full advantage of the boost and still suffer the negative on your other stats.
Lack of counter attack is a minus too
On july 26, 2015
Aardvark

Untouchable is a great skill, but only really useful if you have high agility. If your agility is more than about 10 less than your opponent you'll barely dodge them at all even with untouchable. With immo negating much of the bonus from feline agility you'll struggle to keep it high enough.
immo requires lots of endurance to be worth it, untouchable agility and recon speed. You won't be able to keep up all 3

The glitch would just be a visual glitch.
With your shock, u only disarmed the shuriken she stole from u, but somehow because she Thiefd a weapon, that she also originally has in her inventory. The engine rendered both invisble. But she still had her own.

She would keep the 2nd shuriken in her inventory aslong as she used your Thiefd one, regardless how often u would hit her with sabotage.

On november 30, 2015
[5952489]
Rogue...will they see brutes slightly higher/lower in levels for opponents to fight if there aren't enough on their exact level?...

only brute at your level up to 9 levels lower will be visible in the arena (not sure if can see slightly higher levels). You won't see brutes above your rank (even you're in the same level), only lower ones. Like my case, as lvl 100 padawan, i can't see those from finger flicker but they can see me. My opponents become lesser and lesser as I level up, using coins won't do any good. That's the advantage of BL, you will never run out of opponents. Funny that I can't see "ImmortalAlex" who is 3 levels higher than me.

On november 30, 2015
Abel
Valeculeonly brute at your level up to 9 levels lower will be visible in the arena (not sure if can see slightly higher levels). You won't see brutes above your rank (even you're in the same level), only lower ones. Like my case, as lvl 100 padawan, i can't see those from finger flicker but they can see me. My opponents become lesser and lesser as I level up, using coins won't do any good. That's the advantage of BL, you will never run out of opponents. Funny that I can't see "ImmortalAlex" who is 3 levels higher than me.

You can fight brutes with higher levels, and it's the same 9 level limit. Opponents appear in the order (at least in Padawan):
-Those your level
-Those 1 level above you
-Those 1 level below you
-Those 2 levels above you
-Those 2 levels below you
and so on, but I do not know why your brute can't challenge ImmortalAlex. I doubt alpe retired him since he's still indexed.

Also, alpe once told me about a trick to fight the same brute more than once a day. He mentioned fighting your fights, then training your other brutes (I haven't tested how many you need to train), the brutes you fought will once again appear.

sendos
Hello, I've retuned to this game after nearly 7 years out of curiousity and I discover that mybrute has improved quite a bit. Back then, leveling was a pain and you had no control over what you got at each level up. I'll go straight to the point with my questions, some of them newbish after browsing these forums:


1. What does forking mean? I'm trying to find the context around the word and it either means level up stats only or ditch the brute.
2. Where can I find info on all special and super abilities?
3. Is there a way to earn Muxxu coins without spending real cash?
4. I see something about destinies for your brute. I haven't encountered these yet. Judging by my browsing they're to do with determining what random stuff you get when leveling up, either similar or different. When will I encounter this?
1. Forking is when you choose a different option when leveling up in order to change the choices you get in later levels. For example, in Padawan you choose Broadsword over +3 Agility at level 7, but in Finger Flicker, you choose +3 Agility. This makes the choices you get offered later on change, like if you used to get Dog A or +3 Speed in level 8, now you get offered Whip or +3 Endurance.
[FAQ] Tournament/Destiny/Ranking (v2)
Graphic representation of a destiny being forked

2. Skills (I love when my wiki helps out new players )

3. You can play Carapass, Arkadeo and KadoKado, which eventually give you MTPasses. Each one is worth 100 .

4. Destinies are just what your brute gets during level ups.
What are destinies ?
A Destiny determines the options your brute will be offered during each level up.

What is "Same destiny"/"New Destiny" ?
Both will reset your character at level 1.

-> Same destiny will reset your stats the exact way you had them at level 1. Then, at each level, provided you're making the exact same choices during level up, you will have the exact same options. If you ever happen to make a different choice, the destiny of your character will fork, and you will have new choices.

-> New destiny will build a totally new character, even for the stats, and you will never see a glimpse of the old destiny again. The only things you will keep will be its appearance, and its name.

What kind of destiny do I choose ?
Based on the explanation above, you will have to think for yourself what's best for your character.
However, I would suggest to keep the same destiny, and fork as soon as possible when you've been offered a bad choice.
This way you will be able to come back during the next rank up if you miss what you had before

EDIT 2: A few more questions. I really needed to think over my questions about destinies. Once I return to new level after beating tournament, do I level up faster? Should I avoid doing tournaments until a later level?

This is for the first question you crossed out: Yes, Same destiny means same choices, but keep in mind that if you choose a different choice then from before, the choices afterwards will change. New Destiny just gives you completely different choices from the beginning.

Another tip for that brute is, try to wait for better weapons, fork around and look for a destiny you think will make quick progress.

Regarding the first edit, yes, it pretty much is the exact choices you get, as long as you choose the same options as before. If you don't like the options you get later on, just choose a different choice. Honestly, if I can't find a good path by level 15, I just pick New Destiny.

For your second edit, you don't level up faster, you level up the same as you would when you're a Padawan. Of course, leveling up to level 2 takes only 1 experience but the amount needed for any level doesn't change. Also, there is no reason not to do tournaments, as they provide EXP occasionally, and it has no cost of entering.

UrsuminoWhich weapons should i avoid choosing at all costs? Some weapons like the Piou Piou look kinda useless to me.

Rogue
I know for a face that bumps and fan are pretty much totally useless, then there's other weapons that can turn out being decent with certain specialties.

What he said. Avoid bumps. It's the name for the big wooden club that has terrible accuracy.

Other than that, choosing weapons in general depends on the brute you're making. If you happen to get certain stats before weapons, that can be an indicator of what weapons to acquire. Fast brutes are really good with fast weapons. Highly agile brutes are excellent with throwing and high multi-hit weapons. Strength brutes do well with any melee weapon but they do best with accurate weapons, not necessarily heavy weapons. If you get weapons master, look for swords, knives and sais and get them. If you get martial arts, aim for as few weapons as possible.

I find low agility to mainly be a problem if your brute relies a lot on weapons and less so if your brute has MA and high strength. Moreover, low agility usually hurts by mid-levels of around 30s, where average agility is about 20. It's one of those stats where it does virtually nothing early level and then scales well once you have like 30+ agility. It also scales obviously with fists of fury and untouchable but not only that, the stat also counters itself because it increases accuracy chance as well as dodge chance. Speed, on the other hand, is powerful early game and then drops off unless paired with first strike and a fast weapon.

On a side-note, If strength had the ability to reduce damage by 1 for every 4 strength, fights would last longer at higher levels and strength stat would counter itself, just as agility and speed counter themselves.

The main issue would be leveling slowly during early levels. They do take forever, especially between 10-20. My current destiny is fortunate enough to have a flail at level 2 to guarantee fast early levels. There have been moments where I get close to failing to get 10 fights and it's usually high agility brutes. Once I get more strength, the issue isn't so bad.

[895738]
DaBossThis is a RNG game, your brute just acts like a dumbass from time to time.

The risk is greater with more weapons. The aim is to have as few as possible. Having heaps of weapons increases the chances of the brute just cycling over the weapon and it also reduces the chances of pulling out a preferred weapon at a given moment.

[9658566]

hey how much extra speed does an actual fan or knife give? is it possible to calculate it? http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/150050...
On september 4, 2017
Abel
Kennedyhey how much extra speed does an actual fan or knife give? is it possible to calculate it? http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/150050...

Weapons have a value called Interval that determines how much the brute has to wait before attack again, relative to the opponent. Weapons such as Knife and Fan have very low intervals (60 and 28 respectively).

Here's a page with every weapon's values for Interval.
On september 4, 2017
